file_name: ClickstreamCorp_20200330_1-A_EX1A-6 MAT CTRCT_12089935_EX1A-6 MAT CTRCT_Development Agreement.pdf

perturbation.original_text:
4. TERMINATION.
(a) Types of Termination. This Agreement may be terminated:
1.
By either Party on provision of seven (7) days written notice to the other Party in case of a Force Majeure Event.
2.
Client has the unilateral right to cancel this agreement at any time within a 7-day notice period. Further, Developer can only cancel
due to lack of payment. Client will have a 30 day right to cure before a cancelation can occur.
perturbation.changed_text:
4. TERMINATION.
(a) Types of Termination. This Agreement may be terminated:
1.
By either Party on provision of seven (7) days written notice to the other Party in case of a Force Majeure Event.
2.
Client has the unilateral right to cancel this agreement at any time within a 7-day notice period. Further, Developer can cancel this agreement at any time with written notice.
perturbation.explanation: The original text stated that the Developer could only cancel due to lack of payment by the Client, after a 30-day cure period. The modified version now allows the Developer to cancel the agreement at any time with written notice. This directly contradicts the prior condition and creates uncertainty about the Developer's cancellation rights.

perturbation.original_text:
14. INTELLECTUAL PROPERTY.
(a) No Intellectual Property Infringement by Developer. The Developer hereby represents and warrants that the use and proposed use of the
Application by the Client or any third party does not and shall not infringe, and the Developer has not received any notice, complaint, threat, or
claim alleging infringement of, any trademark, copyright, patent, trade secrets, industrial design, or other rights of any third party in the Application,
and the use of the Application will not include any activity that may constitute “passing off.” To the extent the Application infringes on the rights
of any such third party, the Developer shall obtain a license or consent from such third party permitting the use of the Application. It is hereby
stated, the Application developed under this agreement is the exclusive worldwide sole property of Client.
perturbation.changed_text:
14. INTELLECTUAL PROPERTY.
(a) No Intellectual Property Infringement by Developer. The Developer hereby represents and warrants that the use and proposed use of the
Application by the Client or any third party does not and shall not infringe, and the Developer has not received any notice, complaint, threat, or
claim alleging infringement of, any trademark, copyright, patent, trade secrets, industrial design, or other rights of any third party in the Application,
and the use of the Application will not include any activity that may constitute “passing off.” To the extent the Application infringes on the rights
of any such third party, the Developer shall obtain a license or consent from such third party permitting the use of the Application. The parties will jointly own the application developed under this agreement.
perturbation.explanation: The original text states that the Application developed under this agreement is the exclusive worldwide sole property of Client. The modified version states that the parties will jointly own the application developed under this agreement. This directly contradicts the prior condition and creates uncertainty about the ownership of intellectual property.

perturbation.original_text:
16. ASSIGNMENT.
The Client may assign this Agreement freely, in whole or in part. The Developer may not, without the written consent of the Client, assign,
subcontract, or delegate its obligations under this Agreement, except that the Developer may transfer the right to receive any amounts that may be
payable to it for its Services under this Agreement, which transfer will be effective only after receipt by the Client of written notice of such
assignment or transfer.
perturbation.changed_text:
16. ASSIGNMENT.
Neither the Client nor the Developer may assign this Agreement without the written consent of the other party. However, both parties retain the right to transfer the right to receive any amounts that may be
payable to it for its Services under this Agreement, which transfer will be effective only after receipt by the Client of written notice of such
assignment or transfer.
perturbation.explanation: The original text allowed the Client to assign the Agreement freely, while the Developer required written consent from the Client. The modified version now requires written consent from both parties for assignment. This change contradicts the initial clause that the Client could freely assign the agreement and creates uncertainty about assignment rights.
